trans-unit.source: Panning or scrolling lets users navigate within a single view, to display the content of the view that does not fit within the viewport.
trans-unit.target: Panning or scrolling lets users navigate within a single view, to display the content of the view that does not fit within the viewport.

trans-unit.source: Examples of views include the folder structure of a computer, a library of documents, or a photo album.
trans-unit.target: Examples of views include the folder structure of a computer, a library of documents, or a photo album.

trans-unit.source: Panning
trans-unit.target: Panning

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for panning
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for panning

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Input
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Input

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Xaml.Input
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Xaml.Input

trans-unit.source: Panning or scrolling lets users navigate within a single view, to display the content of the view that does not fit within the viewport.
trans-unit.target: Panning or scrolling lets users navigate within a single view, to display the content of the view that does not fit within the viewport.

trans-unit.source: Examples of views include the folder structure of a computer, a library of documents, or a photo album.
trans-unit.target: Examples of views include the folder structure of a computer, a library of documents, or a photo album.

trans-unit.source: Dos and don'ts
trans-unit.target: Dos and don'ts

trans-unit.source: Panning indicators and scroll bars
trans-unit.target: Panning indicators and scroll bars

trans-unit.source: Ensure panning/scrolling is possible before loading content into your app.
trans-unit.target: Ensure panning/scrolling is possible before loading content into your app.

trans-unit.source: Display panning indicators and scroll bars to provide location and size cues.
trans-unit.target: Display panning indicators and scroll bars to provide location and size cues.

trans-unit.source: Hide them if you provide a custom navigation feature.
trans-unit.target: Hide them if you provide a custom navigation feature.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Unlike standard scroll bars, panning indicators are purely informative.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Unlike standard scroll bars, panning indicators are purely informative.

trans-unit.source: They are not exposed to input devices and cannot be manipulated in any way.
trans-unit.target: They are not exposed to input devices and cannot be manipulated in any way.

trans-unit.source: Single-axis panning (one-dimensional overflow)
trans-unit.target: Single-axis panning (one-dimensional overflow)

trans-unit.source: Use one-axis panning for content regions that extend beyond one viewport boundary (vertical or horizontal).
trans-unit.target: Use one-axis panning for content regions that extend beyond one viewport boundary (vertical or horizontal).

trans-unit.source: Vertical panning for a one-dimensional list of items.
trans-unit.target: Vertical panning for a one-dimensional list of items.

trans-unit.source: Horizontal panning for a grid of items.
trans-unit.target: Horizontal panning for a grid of items.

trans-unit.source: Don’t use mandatory snap-points with single-axis panning if a user must be able to pan and stop between snap-points.
trans-unit.target: Don’t use mandatory snap-points with single-axis panning if a user must be able to pan and stop between snap-points.

trans-unit.source: Mandatory snap-points guarantee that the user will stop on a snap-point.
trans-unit.target: Mandatory snap-points guarantee that the user will stop on a snap-point.

trans-unit.source: Use proximity snap-points instead.
trans-unit.target: Use proximity snap-points instead.

trans-unit.source: Freeform panning (two-dimensional overflow)
trans-unit.target: Freeform panning (two-dimensional overflow)

trans-unit.source: Use two-axis panning for content regions that extend beyond both viewport boundaries (vertical and horizontal).
trans-unit.target: Use two-axis panning for content regions that extend beyond both viewport boundaries (vertical and horizontal).

trans-unit.source: Override the default rails behavior and use freeform panning for unstructured content where the user is likely to move in multiple directions.
trans-unit.target: Override the default rails behavior and use freeform panning for unstructured content where the user is likely to move in multiple directions.

trans-unit.source: Freeform panning is typically suited to navigating within images or maps.
trans-unit.target: Freeform panning is typically suited to navigating within images or maps.

trans-unit.source: Paged view
trans-unit.target: Paged view

trans-unit.source: Use mandatory snap-points when the content is composed of discrete elements or you want to display an entire element.
trans-unit.target: Use mandatory snap-points when the content is composed of discrete elements or you want to display an entire element.

trans-unit.source: This can include pages of a book or magazine, a column of items, or individual images.
trans-unit.target: This can include pages of a book or magazine, a column of items, or individual images.

trans-unit.source: A snap-point should be placed at each logical boundary.
trans-unit.target: A snap-point should be placed at each logical boundary.

trans-unit.source: Each element should be sized or scaled to fit the view.
trans-unit.target: Each element should be sized or scaled to fit the view.

trans-unit.source: Logical and key points
trans-unit.target: Logical and key points

trans-unit.source: Use proximity snap-points if there are key points or logical places in the content that a user will likely stop.
trans-unit.target: Use proximity snap-points if there are key points or logical places in the content that a user will likely stop.

trans-unit.source: For example, a section header.
trans-unit.target: For example, a section header.

trans-unit.source: If maximum and minimum size constraints or boundaries are defined, use visual feedback to demonstrate when the user reaches or exceeds those boundaries.
trans-unit.target: If maximum and minimum size constraints or boundaries are defined, use visual feedback to demonstrate when the user reaches or exceeds those boundaries.

trans-unit.source: Chaining embedded or nested content
trans-unit.target: Chaining embedded or nested content

trans-unit.source: Use single-axis panning (typically horizontal) and column layouts for text and grid-based content.
trans-unit.target: Use single-axis panning (typically horizontal) and column layouts for text and grid-based content.

trans-unit.source: In these cases, content typically wraps and flows naturally from column to column and keeps the user experience consistent and discoverable across Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: In these cases, content typically wraps and flows naturally from column to column and keeps the user experience consistent and discoverable across Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: Don't use embedded pannable regions to display text or item lists.
trans-unit.target: Don't use embedded pannable regions to display text or item lists.

trans-unit.source: Because the panning indicators and scroll bars are displayed only when the input contact is detected within the region, it is not an intuitive or discoverable user experience.
trans-unit.target: Because the panning indicators and scroll bars are displayed only when the input contact is detected within the region, it is not an intuitive or discoverable user experience.

trans-unit.source: Don't chain or place one pannable region within another pannable region if they both pan in the same direction, as shown here.
trans-unit.target: Don't chain or place one pannable region within another pannable region if they both pan in the same direction, as shown here.

trans-unit.source: This can result in the parent area being panned unintentionally when a boundary for the child area is reached.
trans-unit.target: This can result in the parent area being panned unintentionally when a boundary for the child area is reached.

trans-unit.source: Consider making the panning axis perpendicular.
trans-unit.target: Consider making the panning axis perpendicular.

trans-unit.source: image demonstrating an embedded pannable area that scrolls in the same direction as its container.
trans-unit.target: image demonstrating an embedded pannable area that scrolls in the same direction as its container.

trans-unit.source: Additional usage guidance
trans-unit.target: Additional usage guidance

trans-unit.source: Panning with touch, by using a swipe or slide gesture with one or more fingers, is like scrolling with the mouse.
trans-unit.target: Panning with touch, by using a swipe or slide gesture with one or more fingers, is like scrolling with the mouse.

trans-unit.source: The panning interaction is most similar to rotating the mouse wheel or sliding the scroll box, rather than clicking the scroll bar.
trans-unit.target: The panning interaction is most similar to rotating the mouse wheel or sliding the scroll box, rather than clicking the scroll bar.

trans-unit.source: Unless a distinction is made in an API or required by some device-specific Windows UI, we simply refer to both interactions as panning.
trans-unit.target: Unless a distinction is made in an API or required by some device-specific Windows UI, we simply refer to both interactions as panning.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the input device, the user pans within a pannable region by using one of these:
trans-unit.target: Depending on the input device, the user pans within a pannable region by using one of these:

trans-unit.source: A mouse, touchpad, or active pen/stylus to click the scroll arrows, drag the scroll box, or click within the scroll bar.
trans-unit.target: A mouse, touchpad, or active pen/stylus to click the scroll arrows, drag the scroll box, or click within the scroll bar.

trans-unit.source: The wheel button of the mouse to emulate dragging the scroll box.
trans-unit.target: The wheel button of the mouse to emulate dragging the scroll box.

trans-unit.source: The extended buttons (XBUTTON1 and XBUTTON2), if supported by the mouse.
trans-unit.target: The extended buttons (XBUTTON1 and XBUTTON2), if supported by the mouse.

trans-unit.source: The keyboard arrow keys to emulate dragging the scroll box or the page keys to emulate clicking within the scroll bar.
trans-unit.target: The keyboard arrow keys to emulate dragging the scroll box or the page keys to emulate clicking within the scroll bar.

trans-unit.source: Touch, touchpad, or passive pen/stylus to slide or swipe the fingers in the desired direction.
trans-unit.target: Touch, touchpad, or passive pen/stylus to slide or swipe the fingers in the desired direction.

trans-unit.source: Sliding involves moving the fingers slowly in the panning direction.
trans-unit.target: Sliding involves moving the fingers slowly in the panning direction.

trans-unit.source: This results in a one-to-one relationship, where the content pans at the same speed and distance as the fingers.
trans-unit.target: This results in a one-to-one relationship, where the content pans at the same speed and distance as the fingers.

trans-unit.source: Swiping, which involves rapidly sliding and lifting the fingers, results in the following physics being applied to the panning animation:
trans-unit.target: Swiping, which involves rapidly sliding and lifting the fingers, results in the following physics being applied to the panning animation:

trans-unit.source: Deceleration (inertia): Lifting the fingers causes panning to start decelerating.
trans-unit.target: Deceleration (inertia): Lifting the fingers causes panning to start decelerating.

trans-unit.source: This is similar to sliding to a stop on a slippery surface.
trans-unit.target: This is similar to sliding to a stop on a slippery surface.

trans-unit.source: Absorption: Panning momentum during deceleration causes a slight bounce-back effect if either a snap point or a content area boundary is reached.
trans-unit.target: Absorption: Panning momentum during deceleration causes a slight bounce-back effect if either a snap point or a content area boundary is reached.

trans-unit.source: Types of panning
trans-unit.target: Types of panning

trans-unit.source: Windows 8 supports three types of panning:
trans-unit.target: Windows 8 supports three types of panning:

trans-unit.source: Single axis - panning is supported in one direction only (horizontal or vertical).
trans-unit.target: Single axis - panning is supported in one direction only (horizontal or vertical).

trans-unit.source: Rails - panning is supported in all directions.
trans-unit.target: Rails - panning is supported in all directions.

trans-unit.source: However, once the user crosses a distance threshold in a specific direction, then panning is restricted to that axis.
trans-unit.target: However, once the user crosses a distance threshold in a specific direction, then panning is restricted to that axis.

trans-unit.source: Freeform - panning is supported in all directions.
trans-unit.target: Freeform - panning is supported in all directions.

trans-unit.source: Panning UI
trans-unit.target: Panning UI

trans-unit.source: The interaction experience for panning is unique to the input device while still providing similar functionality.
trans-unit.target: The interaction experience for panning is unique to the input device while still providing similar functionality.

trans-unit.source: **Pannable regions** Pannable region behaviors are exposed to Windows Store app using JavaScript developers at design time through Cascading Style Sheets (CSS).
trans-unit.target: **Pannable regions** Pannable region behaviors are exposed to Windows Store app using JavaScript developers at design time through Cascading Style Sheets (CSS).

trans-unit.source: There are two panning display modes based on the input device detected:
trans-unit.target: There are two panning display modes based on the input device detected:

trans-unit.source: Panning indicators for touch.
trans-unit.target: Panning indicators for touch.

trans-unit.source: Scroll bars for other input devices, including mouse, touchpad, keyboard, and stylus.
trans-unit.target: Scroll bars for other input devices, including mouse, touchpad, keyboard, and stylus.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Panning indicators are only visible when the touch contact is within the pannable region.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Panning indicators are only visible when the touch contact is within the pannable region.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, the scroll bar is only visible when the mouse cursor, pen/stylus cursor, or keyboard focus is within the scrollable region.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, the scroll bar is only visible when the mouse cursor, pen/stylus cursor, or keyboard focus is within the scrollable region.

trans-unit.source: **Panning indicators** Panning indicators are similar to the scroll box in a scroll bar.
trans-unit.target: **Panning indicators** Panning indicators are similar to the scroll box in a scroll bar.

trans-unit.source: They indicate the proportion of displayed content to total pannable area and the relative position of the displayed content in the pannable area.
trans-unit.target: They indicate the proportion of displayed content to total pannable area and the relative position of the displayed content in the pannable area.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram shows two pannable areas of different lengths and their panning indicators.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram shows two pannable areas of different lengths and their panning indicators.

trans-unit.source: image showing two pannable areas of different lengths and their panning indicators.
trans-unit.target: image showing two pannable areas of different lengths and their panning indicators.

trans-unit.source: **Panning behaviors** **Snap points** Panning with the swipe gesture introduces inertia behavior into the interaction when the touch contact is lifted.
trans-unit.target: **Panning behaviors** **Snap points** Panning with the swipe gesture introduces inertia behavior into the interaction when the touch contact is lifted.

trans-unit.source: With inertia, the content continues to pan until some distance threshold is reached without direct input from the user.
trans-unit.target: With inertia, the content continues to pan until some distance threshold is reached without direct input from the user.

trans-unit.source: Use snap points to modify this inertia behavior.
trans-unit.target: Use snap points to modify this inertia behavior.

trans-unit.source: Snap points specify logical stops in your app content.
trans-unit.target: Snap points specify logical stops in your app content.

trans-unit.source: Cognitively, snap points act as a paging mechanism for the user and minimize fatigue from excessive sliding or swiping in large pannable regions.
trans-unit.target: Cognitively, snap points act as a paging mechanism for the user and minimize fatigue from excessive sliding or swiping in large pannable regions.

trans-unit.source: With them, you can handle imprecise user input and ensure a specific subset of content or key information is displayed in the viewport.
trans-unit.target: With them, you can handle imprecise user input and ensure a specific subset of content or key information is displayed in the viewport.

trans-unit.source: There are two types of snap-points:
trans-unit.target: There are two types of snap-points:

trans-unit.source: Proximity - After the contact is lifted, a snap point is selected if inertia stops within a distance threshold of the snap point.
trans-unit.target: Proximity - After the contact is lifted, a snap point is selected if inertia stops within a distance threshold of the snap point.

trans-unit.source: Panning can still stop between proximity snap points.
trans-unit.target: Panning can still stop between proximity snap points.

trans-unit.source: Mandatory - The snap point selected is the one that immediately precedes or succeeds the last snap point crossed before the contact was lifted (depending on the direction and velocity of the gesture).
trans-unit.target: Mandatory - The snap point selected is the one that immediately precedes or succeeds the last snap point crossed before the contact was lifted (depending on the direction and velocity of the gesture).

trans-unit.source: Panning must stop on a mandatory snap point.
trans-unit.target: Panning must stop on a mandatory snap point.

trans-unit.source: Panning snap-points are useful for applications such as web browsers and photo albums that emulate paginated content or have logical groupings of items that can be dynamically regrouped to fit within a viewport or display.
trans-unit.target: Panning snap-points are useful for applications such as web browsers and photo albums that emulate paginated content or have logical groupings of items that can be dynamically regrouped to fit within a viewport or display.

trans-unit.source: The following diagrams show how panning to a certain point and releasing causes the content to automatically pan to a logical location.
trans-unit.target: The following diagrams show how panning to a certain point and releasing causes the content to automatically pan to a logical location.

trans-unit.source: image showing a pannable area.
trans-unit.target: image showing a pannable area.

trans-unit.source: image showing a pannable area being panned to the left.
trans-unit.target: image showing a pannable area being panned to the left.

trans-unit.source: image showing a pannable area that has stopped panning at a logical snap-point.
trans-unit.target: image showing a pannable area that has stopped panning at a logical snap-point.

trans-unit.source: Swipe to pan.
trans-unit.target: Swipe to pan.

trans-unit.source: Lift touch contact.
trans-unit.target: Lift touch contact.

trans-unit.source: Pannable region stops at the snap point, not where the touch contact was lifted.
trans-unit.target: Pannable region stops at the snap point, not where the touch contact was lifted.

trans-unit.source: **Rails** Content can be wider and taller than the dimensions and resolution of a display device.
trans-unit.target: **Rails** Content can be wider and taller than the dimensions and resolution of a display device.

trans-unit.source: For this reason, two-dimensional panning (horizontal and vertical) is often necessary.
trans-unit.target: For this reason, two-dimensional panning (horizontal and vertical) is often necessary.

trans-unit.source: Rails improve the user experience in these cases by emphasizing panning along the axis of motion (vertical or horizontal).
trans-unit.target: Rails improve the user experience in these cases by emphasizing panning along the axis of motion (vertical or horizontal).

trans-unit.source: The following diagram demonstrates the concept of rails.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram demonstrates the concept of rails.

trans-unit.source: diagram of a screen with rails that constrain panning
trans-unit.target: diagram of a screen with rails that constrain panning

trans-unit.source: Chaining embedded or nested content
trans-unit.target: Chaining embedded or nested content

trans-unit.source: After a user hits a zoom or scroll limit on an element that has been nested within another zoomable or scrollable element, you can specify whether that parent element should continue the zooming or scrolling operation begun in its child element.
trans-unit.target: After a user hits a zoom or scroll limit on an element that has been nested within another zoomable or scrollable element, you can specify whether that parent element should continue the zooming or scrolling operation begun in its child element.

trans-unit.source: This is called zoom or scroll chaining.
trans-unit.target: This is called zoom or scroll chaining.

trans-unit.source: Chaining is used for panning within a single-axis content area that contains one or more single-axis or freeform panning regions (when the touch contact is within one of these child regions).
trans-unit.target: Chaining is used for panning within a single-axis content area that contains one or more single-axis or freeform panning regions (when the touch contact is within one of these child regions).

trans-unit.source: When the panning boundary of the child region is reached in a specific direction, panning is then activated on the parent region in the same direction.
trans-unit.target: When the panning boundary of the child region is reached in a specific direction, panning is then activated on the parent region in the same direction.

trans-unit.source: When a pannable region is nested inside another pannable region it's important to specify enough space between the container and the embedded content.
trans-unit.target: When a pannable region is nested inside another pannable region it's important to specify enough space between the container and the embedded content.

trans-unit.source: In the following diagrams, one pannable region is placed inside another pannable region, each going in perpendicular directions.
trans-unit.target: In the following diagrams, one pannable region is placed inside another pannable region, each going in perpendicular directions.

trans-unit.source: There is plenty of space for users to pan in each region.
trans-unit.target: There is plenty of space for users to pan in each region.

trans-unit.source: image demonstrating an embedded pannable area.
trans-unit.target: image demonstrating an embedded pannable area.

trans-unit.source: Without enough space, as shown in the following diagram, the embedded pannable region can interfere with panning in the container and result in unintentional panning in one or more of the pannable regions.
trans-unit.target: Without enough space, as shown in the following diagram, the embedded pannable region can interfere with panning in the container and result in unintentional panning in one or more of the pannable regions.

trans-unit.source: image demonstrating insufficient padding for an embedded pannable area.
trans-unit.target: image demonstrating insufficient padding for an embedded pannable area.

trans-unit.source: This guidance is also useful for apps such as photo albums or mapping apps that support unconstrained panning within an individual image or map while also supporting single-axis panning within the album (to the previous or next images) or details area.
trans-unit.target: This guidance is also useful for apps such as photo albums or mapping apps that support unconstrained panning within an individual image or map while also supporting single-axis panning within the album (to the previous or next images) or details area.

trans-unit.source: In apps that provide a detail or options area corresponding to a freeform panning image or map, we recommend that the page layout start with the details and options area as the unconstrained panning area of the image or map might interfere with panning to the details area.
trans-unit.target: In apps that provide a detail or options area corresponding to a freeform panning image or map, we recommend that the page layout start with the details and options area as the unconstrained panning area of the image or map might interfere with panning to the details area.
